solution_line_template: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle ({truck_capacity} head of cattle), the {total_cattle} head of cattle will require {total_cattle}/{truck_capacity}=<<{total_cattle}/{truck_capacity}={num_trips}>>{num_trips} trips using his transport vehicle.
Traveling to the site at {travel_speed} mph for {distance} miles it will take {distance}/{travel_speed}=<<{distance}/{travel_speed}={one_way_time}>>{one_way_time} hour to travel one-way.

Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take {round_trip_factor}*{one_way_time}=<<{round_trip_factor}*{one_way_time}={round_trip_time}>>{round_trip_time} hours.
Thus, {num_trips} complete trips will take {num_trips}*{round_trip_time}=<<{num_trips}*{round_trip_time}={total_driving_time}>>{total_driving_time} hours of driving time.
